subject: The CNN Political Ticker PM, Wednesday, April 25, 2007
body:
CNN.com - CNN Political Ticker










For the latest, breaking political news, check for updates
throughout the day on the CNN Political Ticker
http://www.cnn.com/ticker All politics, all the
time.

Today on the Ticker 

Clinton, Obama strike back at Giuliani

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- The two front-runners in the race
for the Democratic presidential nomination rebuked Republican
White House rival Rudy Giuliani on Wednesday for suggesting the
United States could face another major terrorist attack if a
Democrat is elected in 2008.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/clinton-obama-strike-back-at-giuliani.html

***

It's official: McCain is in the race

PORTSMOUTH, New Hampshire (CNN) -- Republican Sen.
John McCain, who has been campaigning for president for months,
officially announced his run for the White House Wednesday,
stressing the need for Democratic-Republican unity.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/its-official-mccain-is-in-race.html

***

Romney begins national TV ad campaign

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Former Massachusetts Gov. Mitt Romney
began his national presidential television ad campaign
Wednesday, the same day fellow Republican candidate Sen. John
McCain officially launched his White House bid.

Full
story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/romney-begins-national-tv-ad-campaign.html

***

Pryor renews call for Gonzales to step down
after meeting with him

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- In
an effort to mend fences on Capitol Hill, embattled U.S.
Attorney Gen. Alberto Gonzales met with Sen. Mark Pryor,
D-Arkansas, who recently accused Gonzales of lying about the
firing of a U.S. attorney in is home state. But the 40-minute
Capitol Hill meeting failed to sway Pryor who told reporters
afterwards that he still thinks Gonzales should resign.

Full story:http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/its-official-mccain-is-in-race.html

***

Hunter calls for Reid to step down over 'war is
lost' remarks

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Rep. Duncan
Hunter called Wednesday for Sen. Harry Reid to resign his post
as Senate majority leader over remarks that the senator made
last week that the war in Iraq "is lost" if the United States
continues on its current policy. 

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/hunter-calls-for-reid-to-step-down-over.html

***

House Judiciary Committee authorizes grant of
immunity for Goodling

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- The
House Judiciary Committee voted Wednesday 32-6 to authorize a
grant of immunity for former Justice Department official Monica
Goodling. 

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/house-judiciary-committee-authorizes.html

***

Senate Judiciary Committee subpoenas White
House political director

WASHINGTON (CNN) --
The Senate Judiciary Committee Wednesday authorized its
committee chairman to subpoena White House Political Director
Sara Taylor as part of the investigation into the firing of
eight U.S. attorneys.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/senate-judiciary-committee-subpoenas.html

***

Burnett, MySpace to launch political reality
show

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Reality TV guru Mark
Burnett and the popular social networking site MySpace.com are
teaming up to launch a political reality show that aims to find
a candidate to run in the 2008 presidential election.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/burnett-myspace-to-launch-political.html
